channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023110990
item.description:
Report X-2023110990

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART A AND 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART B ONE OF THE BOTTLES OF PART A HAD A PUNCTURE HOLE WHICH CAUSED 10% LEAKAGE FROM THE BOTTLE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023110979
item.description:
Report X-2023110979

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the plastic bottles arrived at the hazmat cage in a tote. Original packaging was and is missing and the 4 plastic bottles containing Diversey Suma Dip Liquid Presoak were soiled barely readable. All that was recovered was a relabel and the bottles. 3 of the 4 bottles seem to have leaked out some product all missing different amounts of product. Bottles wee placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure seems to have been from a several loose caps causing 3 of 4 bottles to leak out all different amounts of product. The first bottle, Leaked out almost half a gallon of the liquid. The second bottle, leaked out about half a cup. The third bottle leaked out about a cup. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were closed tightly and placed into salvage drum upright to stop any further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023110934
item.description:
Report X-2023110934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found on van line on 11/10 appearing mostly undamaged but with small paint leak or smear on top closure. Package was isolated from sort by line manager for inspection by QA. As box is an undeclared hazmat with no markings on box, it was placed in black non-hazmat bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection. QA was unable to inspect package on 11/10 and held box for inspection overnight. On 11/11, package was inspected and discovered to be an undeclared hazmat. Package was then placed in a red hazmat bin with hazmat liner. DescribePack: Outer package appears undamaged, with no punctures or tears on box, but with a small amount of paint leaking from edge of top closure. Leak almost fully contained inside package. Package contains 2 paint cans; 1 can has been dented, pushing lid up and allowing leak. Other can appears undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leak contained almost fully inside box and did not affect other packages. Box was first placed in a plain black bin with plain plastic liner and brought to QA for inspection; when package was discovered to be an undeclared hazmat, it was moved into a red hazmat bin with hazmat bag liner.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection of "FIVE STAR SANICLEAN" showed package to be wet, lying sideways, with internal leakage, from loose cap. Damage most likely from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining content will be disposed of in a salvage drum, due to unsecure leaking cap.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: PACKAGE CAME TO THE IRREG BELT DUE TO THE 76LB WEIGHT. RMP NOTICED LEAKING MERCURY. MANAGEMENT STOPPED THE PROCESS. MANAGER AND 2 RMPS RESPONDED. SECURED THE AREA. PLACED BOOM AND CAUTION TAPE. ENVIRONMENTAL CEC WAS NOTIFIED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER CALLED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER COMPLETED THE CLEAN, REMOVED ALL DEBRIS AND CYLINDER. RESPNDER NOTED PROPER RQ DOT SPECIAL PERMIT PACKAGING PROCESS WAS NOT COMPLETED BY SHIPPER.

item.title: Report X-2023110862
item.description:
Report X-2023110862

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET AND LEAKING. IMMEDIATELY TOOK PKG OVER TO THE K=HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT. I REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIAMTELY 2 OUNCES LEAKED OUT DUE TO A CAP BEING LOOSE ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PKG. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES WHICH CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 2 OUNCES TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PKG OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT. THEN REPACKING IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

About (1) oz. of Hydroxyacetic Acid, trade name unknown, was released and contained to the package with shrink wrap around it. Nothing has released except for under the shrink wrap, with proper PPE Abraham will be able to safely put the box into a poly overpack. No drains, waterways, or environmental impact.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE IN A TOTE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING ISOPROPY ALCOHOL WAS FOUND WITH 1 OF THE BOTTLES DAMAGED. THE BOTTLE WAS SLIGHTY LEAKED OUT. THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE CAP BEING LOOSE CAUSING 1 BOTTLE OF ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL TO BE DAMAGED. ( LEAKING). DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023110140
item.description:
Report X-2023110140

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEIN PUNCTURED AND SPILLAGE. DescribePack: The package was discovered in the damaged hazmat area after completing processing hazmat. The package was removed from the system flow, due to leakage. Upon inspection of the METAL CAN OF THERMO FISHER SCIENTIFIC TOLUENE 20 LITERS, a small puncture hole that triggered a slow leakage of contents DUE TO MISHANDLING AT THE TERMINAL. There was about 10 ounces of leakage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING NITRIC ACID WAS FOUND COMPLETELY WET AND THE BOTTLE HAD A SMALL CRACK CAUSING IT TO LEAK. THE BOX WAS HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE DISPOSED OF UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE BOTTLED BEING CRACKED CAUSING THE PACKAGE OF NITRIC ACID TO BE DAMAGED. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.
